column1: Catende is a Brazilian municipality in the state of Pernambuco. Has an estimated population in 2009 of 35.251 inhabitants in a total area of  206.92 km². The economy is based on the cultivation of sugarcane and the production of derived products (sugar and ethanol).  Catende used to boast the world's largest sugar mill.
Boundaries - Bonito  (N); Palmares  (E);  Maraial and Jaqueira  (S);  Belém de Maria  (W)
The main economic activities in Catende are based in industry
column2: commerce and agribusiness especially sugarcane and cattle.
